intro: Mazus miquelii var. stolonifer, commonly known as the creeping mazus, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It features prostrate stems that spread along the ground, forming dense mats of foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers in shades of pink or white, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical, with a soft, hairy texture, and are arranged alternately along the stems. Mazus miquelii var. stolonifer is well adapted to rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
